page.title: 01GENERAL INTRODUCTION
page.content: In many ways this is an ideal place tp live, being within a short distance of a major city and yet bordering on the great expense of countryside to the west and north including the beautiful Tynedale. During the last ten years, private housing estates have been built on the south side of the original linear settlement of Crawcrook. These are in direct contrast to the terraced colliery houses still in good condition after more than three quarters of a century. This area has few remaining signs of the once thriving coal industry other than disused wagonways, a monument marking Chatherne Shaft at Westburn and the Emma Colliery First Aid building. Some small factories are operating on the sites of Stargate & Greenside collieries but the main industries are farming and quarrying
